--- In junit@egroups.com, Gerry Wheeler <gwheeler@v...> wrote:
> What about enhancing InvocationTargetException so it holds a
> reference  to another exception. Then the catch could instantiate
> a new exception, insert the reference to the caught exception, and
> throw the new one. The contained exception should hold the stack
> information about the original exception. This technique is used
> with JMSException and seems to work well.

FYI, the above is exactly what NUnit for .Net does.
http://nunit.sourceforge.net/

> It would have been nice if there were an interface that described
> the methods setLinkedException and getLinkedException (or whatever
> you choose to call them) so code could have a general way to look
> for contained exceptions.

Yep, except it's called getInnerException/setInnerException.
